cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore
.

Played since launch of OW1. OW2, besides being an obvious scam, has been a great disappointment in most aspects. Nothing that ruined the first game and turned away the community has changed. Regardless of the desperation they find themselves in, they continue to employ the same exact practices that drove the community away in record breaking numbers.

Despite the fact that balance changes are (according to devs) made almost exclusively based on high tier meta, the game is still horrifically unbalanced. The devs are actively mad that you are not playing the way they want you to and will gladly take away any enjoyment you had here to fix that. Most changes seem to be based solely on the metric of which hero is being played the least, which can be hard to tell since they have made SO many heroes so un-fun to play. At that, the changes (you'll recognize this if you've played basically any other game from blizzblazz) are always polarized into extremely small and unnoticeable changes to characters that the community has complained about, and game breaking changes to the dev's current favorite that makes competitive borderline unplayable until the "oopsie we're sorry" patch three days later. 

Tanks often invalidate DPS, made worse with the fact that healers are basically expected to pick up some DPS as well. Snipers still dominate at all levels of play thanks to mobility differences and more than half the roster being in one-shot range. Torbjorn is still Torbjorn.
Many heroes are now locked behind paywall, and players are able to enter into competitive with these heroes locked.New heroes can be unlocked in the season they released in by playing a certain amount of hours, but older heroes remain locked if you didn't buy OW1. Combined with the hilariously low requirement to gain access to competitive, low to mid tier ranks are plagued with inexperienced players who do not access to mechanics and strategies players who have paid for characters / been around and had time to unlock them in the battle pass. 

Premium currency in the original game could be gained by getting duplicates from loot boxes that you got for free at every level up, but for the new F2P model they've opted to make the premium currency MUCH more difficult to obtain without purchase. They're charging 15-20 USD for premium shop and league shop exclusive skins.

Any player you asked would have told you that no one wanted a battle pass system but they did it anyway. Content of the battle pass seems to get worse with every season, loosely tied themes and leftover concepts to throw at the players so they'll subscribe to a service that they may or may not even get their money's worth from if they don't put in enough play time and pad our player statistics. This has been made even more evident in the Invasion season where the PVE content is being released episodically, which has proven to be desperate in basically every game ever. 

PVE content, of course, was the main selling point of OW2. In case you haven't heard, they lied about this entirely and have since made an official post backtracking on their promises for story missions and hero levels. DO NOT BE FOOLED - the Invasion update is said to contain "story missions" and "hero progression" but the story missions are they same shitty 4 man co-op mode they made for some events in OW1 like Junkenstein and the hero progression is a sad shadow of what they originally promised us, with the added insult of not tracking any stats retroactively, so they expect us to care enough NOW to level our characters up for a reward of.... nothing.

Truth be told, I was skeptical of the story-based content in the first place, considering the dev team uses every opportunity they can to inject politics into the game at every possible turn, literally releasing short stories about characters with the sole purpose of revealing their sexuality (you can reliably guess that they're not coming out as straight). By now we're all aware that Blizzblazz does not hire good writers or care much about their stories but the quality of those famous cutscenes that this company is widely known for has decreased and the dialogue is a little more cringe than your average Mahvel movie. 

This company has done nothing but lie to you for years. Do not be fooled by this sad, desperate attempt to rebuild a player base that they have hated, admonished, punished, and lied to for years. The playerbase and the league scene are dying for a reason.

install game

leave it open for 20 minutes so I can leave a bad review

blizzard doesn't listen to it's player base ever, retracts promises, and ensures no one will have a fun experience because all they care about is money
I can't download it again, this game is not fun, it is not fun at all

Be honest. The moment you saw the announcement that this game was going to be on Steam, your first thought was about how many negative reviews there were gonna be on launch day. Then when it was released, you immediately went to the reviews. You didn't even bother to read anything on the store page. You just went straight for the reviews, laughing while nodding your head saying, "Yep. I knew it," and installed the game only so you can leave a negative review.

As many others have said, the only thing Overwatch is good for now is porn, hentai, ASMR of Widowmaker stepping on you (which I'm totally not guilty of listening to since it was just a big misunderstanding), that video of Chel Hell Bunny cosplaying as D.va and saying "Nerf this" before slapping her thicc ass, twerking like it's â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ jello, then letting out the most wet-sounding fart ever heard in existence to the point where it sounded like Donald Duck having a stroke, etc.
